abstracts.cdata!:
This is the environmental management
            plan for the Krakow Energy Efficiency Project which
            modernizes the district heating system for the city of
            Krakow. during the construction phase, negative
            environmental impacts such as noise, dust, and the
            construction phase, negative environmental impacts such as
            noise, dust, and This is the environmental management plan
            for the Krakow Energy Efficiency Project which modernizes
            the district heating system for the city of Krakow. During
            the construction phase, negative environmental impacts such
            as noise, dust, and traffic disruption will be offset by
            restricting construction operations to noraml daytime hours,
            weting surfaces when dry, hot, or windy, and placing warning
            signs and officials to redirect traffic. Disposal of
            scrap--both nonhazardous and asbestos--will be done by
            licensed operators at government-approved sites. During the
            operations phase, boiler emmissions will comply with Polish
            emission standards and World Bank guidelines. That is, low
            sulfur fuel oil and low nitrous oxide burners will be used.
            A chemical analysis (wet bubbler or automatic) will be done
            either once a year or continuously.
